_emerg_resp.LEPCCoordinationReason: Shell made multiple phone calls and visited the LEPC office on 01/28, 01/29, 01/30/2025 but did not receive a response from the LEPC. Shell will continue periodic efforts to coordinate with the LEPC.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
Shell endeavors in all its activities to promote a quality environment. We recognize that activities at this facility may impact our employees and the surrounding community. Because of this, Shell is dedicated to environmental protection, employee health and safety, regulatory compliance and pollution prevention through a strategy of continual improvement and teamwork.

Our company environmental, health, and safety (EHS) policy and requirements promote the overall safety of this facility, our employees, and the public. This policy includes risk reduction programs that provide assurance for the safe management of process risks to prevent environmental, health and safety incidents and to protect the workplace, the community and the environment. Shell is committed to complying with the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard, Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 1910.119, and EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) regulations, Title 40 CFR Part 68, to deal with the risks involved with the storage, handling, and processing of methane. This program enables the facility to prevent the occurrence, or minimize the consequences of, significant releases of methane.

It is Shells policy to conduct our business in accordance with all applicable laws, regulations, and permits and to promote a safe workplace and a quality environment. Each employee is trained and required to comply strictly with this policy.

Stationary Source and Regulated Substance
The Shell RNG Friesian Biogas Facility located at 3460 South 1600 East, Wendell, Idaho, 83355, conducts a biogas production process that generates methane (74-82-8). The facility is classified as a Prevention Program 3 and is regulated by EPA RMP and OSHA PSM for the flammable substance methane which is held on site in excess of 10,000 lbs.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention
The facilitys overall approach and commitmen

t to chemical safety is demonstrated by 1) the existing management, training, operating procedures, and maintenance systems in place at the facility, and 2) the hazard assessment, prevention program, and emergency response provisions implemented specifically for the biomethane production systems as part of the RMP requirements. The facility has implemented Program 3 Prevention Programs for the biomethane production process. The prevention program provisions are specifically intended to minimize the probability and/or consequences of any accidental releases from this process. Shell updates the facility prevention programs based on periodic training, process hazard review, incident investigations, audits, procedure revisions, and RMP revisions and updates as required to reflect facility changes.

Five-Year Accident History
The facility is new in 2025 and has not had a release of a regulated substance that has caused any injuries to employees or impacted any offsite receptors in the past five years.

Emergency Response Program
As a non-responding facility, the Shell RNG Friesian Biogas Facility is not required to develop or implement an Emergency Response Plan (ERP). Instead, an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) hass been developed by Rev1 Energy to provide a formal emergency preparedness program that protects human health and property in the event of an emergency such as fire, medical, severe weather event, etc. This plan also formalizes the arrangements with local police, fire departments, hospitals, and emergency response personnel in case of an event. Rev1 reviews a copy of this plan with each employee.

Planned Changes
Shell continues to review its programs and procedures and make improvements where necessary. At this time, no significant improvement needs have been identified.
